result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J Burke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Cases 16CF171 and 15TR1670 were dismissed and read in . Inform agent of all prescriptions. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
**ATTEND the Victim IMpact Penal meeting on 08/10/2016 or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for failure to attend.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 15 days were granted. 
*Court authorizes Electronic Monitoring if deemed appropriate by the Huber facility.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Patrick J Burke in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso. Attorney Mark Brellenthin also appears as he is advocate counsel for Defendant on Case #16CF171 which is dismissed and read-in today.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

12 MONTHS HUBER 

*D/L REVOCATION:  36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK:  36 months.

TERM OF PROBATION: 3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed/sign releases
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
*Attendance at Victim Impact Panel on 8/10/16.  Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel 

FINE:  $1,519.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid out of cash bail posted and remainder due - due as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:   6 MONTHS (15 days credit), Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith. Defendant taken into custody.  NOTE:  Court authorizes electronic monitoring if deemed appropriate by huber facility.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Updated witness list, filed by the State.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.

Dated today, from WCS, advising that the Defendant scored high-risk on the approved OWI risk assessment instrument. As a result the supervision provided by WCS will involve case management and monitoring by drug testing.

Defendant Patrick J Burke in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Krause from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department was sworn and testified on behalf of the State.  State presents exhibit #1 marked and received. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects and presents arguments. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
